description: These tasty bowls are one of our favorite summer dinners! I love the contrast of the sweet, refreshing peach salsa with the creamy avocado.
author: Larry Jones
ingredients: 1½ cups cooked black beans, drained and rinsed
preperationStep: Assemble bowls with the rice, beans, and avocado.
Top with scoops of the peach salsa and drizzle with the cilantro lime dressing.
Garnish with more herbs. Season to taste and serve with lime wedges.

description: Bake a potato perfectly every time! With the olive oil & sea salt coating, it'll come out of the oven with crispy skin and fluffy insides that are delicious with your favorite toppings.
author: Samuel Jones Gamgii
preperationStep: Preheat the oven to 425°F and line two baking sheet with parchment paper.
Use a fork to poke a few holes into the potatoes.
Place on the baking sheet, rub with olive oil, and sprinkle liberally with sea salt all over.
Bake 45 to 60 minutes, or until the potato is fork-tender and the skin is crisp.
Assemble with a dollop of sour cream or cashew cream, tempeh bacon bits, and a sprinkle of chives.
Serve with remaining cashew cream and tempeh bacon on the side.

description: Served it over angel hair pasta along with some steamed spinach and a salad, and a lovely bottle of dry, crisp white French wine. Oh my, what a meal
author: Bill Bunt
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
2 pounds large shrimp - peeled and deveined
preperationStep: In a large bowl, mix together softened butter, olive oil, garlic, shallots, chives, salt, pepper, and paprika; add the shrimp, and toss to coat.
Lightly oil grill grate. Cook the shrimp as close to the flame as possible for 2 to 3 minutes per side, or until opaque.

description: Served it over angel hair pasta along with some steamed spinach and a salad, and a lovely bottle of dry, crisp white French wine. Oh my, what a meal
author: Bruce Bruceface
ingredients: aa1 (14.75 ounce) can salmon, drained of all but 2 tablespoons of liquid, flaked
1 large slice bread , crust removed, shredded (1 cup, 50g)
1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped, or 1 teaspoon dried
Several turns of freshly ground black pepper
